Executive Summary
Specialty Products US, LLC is a wholly owned subsidiary of International Flavors & Fragrances, Inc (IFF).

Institute Site
The Institute Site is an Industrial Park owned by ALTIVIA Corporation with several manufacturing facility tenants producing specialty chemical products.  

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Procedures Policies
Specialty Products US, LLC is strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at our facility.  
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Procedures and Policies are present in the   Institute Operations Emergency Operations Manual.
It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  If such a release should occur, highly trained emergency response personnel are at hand to control and mitigate the effects of the release.  

Stationary Source and Regulated Substances 
Specialty Products US, LLC is a manufacturing facility that produces specialty chemical products.  Most products are intermediates used in other processes or sold to customers who convert them into finished products. 
Specialty Products US, LLC currently handles and stores isopentane and anhydrous ammonia RMP regulated chemicals in threshold quantities at this site in our process unit.  Isopentane is stored in threshold quantities at our transportation storage area.

Five Year Accident History
Specialty Products US, LLC at the Institute site has an excellent record of preventing accidental releases over the last 5 years.  Due to our stringent release prevention policies, there have been no significant releases with offsite impact as defined by the RMP rule of regulated substances.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program 
Specialt

y Products US, LLCs general accident prevention program consists of compliance with the EPA RMP rule, OSHA's PSM standard, and operating discipline management system and standards.  Key elements include:

Process Safety Information
We maintain detailed records of safety information that describe the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with all covered processes.  Examples include, but are not limited to, Safety Data Sheets for all the hazardous chemicals, equipment design specification sheets, and reactive chemicals test results.  This information is maintained up-to-date and is available to operating personnel.

Process Hazard Analysis
Our facility conducts comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards associated with our processes are identified, evaluated, and controlled efficiently.  The methodologies used to carry out these analyses may include: Checklists, What If/Checklists (combined), Hazard and Operability Studies (HAZOPs), Reactive Chemical/Process Hazard Analyses, Chemical Exposure Index, Fire & Explosion Index, and Layers of Protection Analyses.  The studies are undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and are revalidated at regular intervals.  Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.

Operating Procedures
For the purposes of safely conducting activities within our covered processes, we maintain written operating procedures.  These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown and startup after a turnaround.  The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved in the processes.

Training
Specialty Products US, LLC has a training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating and maintaining processes are competent in the procedures associated with these proces

ses.  Refresher training is provided on a continuing basis.

Mechanical Integrity
Specialty Products US, LLC utilizes a planned preventative maintenance program which conducts periodic inspections to ensure all equipment is maintained in a manner which prevents releases to the environment.  Process equipment examined by these checks includes, but is not limited to: pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls, pumps, and compressors.  Maintenance operations are carried out by qualified personnel with training in maintenance practices.  Furthermore, these personnel are offered specialized training as needed.  Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

Management of Change
Specialty Products US, LLC facility requires management of modifications to process equipment, procedures, raw materials, and processing conditions other than "like for like", by identifying, documenting, and reviewing them prior to implementation of changes.  Process operators, maintenance personnel or any other employee whose job tasks are affected by a modification in process conditions are promptly made aware of and receive training prior to the modification.

Pre-startup Reviews
Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and to modifications in established processes are conducted.  These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.

Compliance Audits
Compliance audits are conducted on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP rule are being implemented. Audits are conducted using established schedules and any corrective actions required as a result of the audits are undertaken in a safe and prompt manner.

Incident Investigation
Specialty Products US, LLC promptly investigates any incident that has

resulted in, or could reasonably result in a significant release of a regulated substance. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years.

Employee Participation
Specialty Products US, LLC believes that process safety management and accident prevention is a team effort. Our employees working in our plant are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements.  In addition, our employees have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation of the RMP rule, including information resulting from process hazard analyses in particular.

Contractors
Specialty Products US, LLC hires contractors to perform some specialized maintenance, distribution, and construction activities.  Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety performance of the contractor is performed.  Specialty Products US, LLC has a strict policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards related to the contractor's work and the processes he/she may encounter while on site.  Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release of a regulated substance occur.

Emergency Response Program
The overall site Emergency Response Plan and team located at the Institute site is managed by ALTIVIA.  The onsite Emergency Response Team consists of members from various tenants which Specialty Products US, LLC employees participates.

The Institute Industrial Park Site Emergency Services contact owned by ALTIVIA is Omar Withrow.  His role as the ESS Leader is to oversee the site Emergency Response Program operations.  His contact information is:
email: owithrow@altivia.com
phone: 304-759-1299 extension 427

The emergency response program provides the essential planning and training for effectiv

ely protecting workers, the public, and the environment during emergency situations.  Detailed emergency response plans are developed and coordinated with the Kanawha/Putnam Emergency Planning Committee and the community.

The Institute site has a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post- incident decontamination of affected areas.  The plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within our processes that would require a modified emergency response.

To ensure proper functioning, quarterly emergency drills are conducted by the site host (ALTIVIA) to enhance skills and tactics for responding to an accidental chemical release.  Critiques are held on drills and actual events.  Emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced.

Kanawha/Putnam EPC is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which Institute's emergency plan has been coordinated and verified.

Planned Changes to improve Safety
We continue to implement projects to improve process safety as opportunities are identified via external regulatory changes and/or internal process safety program changes or evaluations.
